Reviews.Title: “The Staff Couldn't Of Been More Accomadating”
Reviews.Author: SunWorshipper183
Reviews.Content: To start with the bad we booked a King bed and was given a double. The hotel was lovely. The staff were amazing, helpful, polite. The breakfast was lovely and we had a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. It was very clean and provided Shower gel etc. The computer in what they call the "business centre" is broken and slow, really needs replacing. The first morning they knocked on the door three times to see if we wanted our room cleaned. The first time was understandable as we didnt put a do not disturb sign on however the second and third was not, they just kept knocking until we answered and there was no communication. The tempreture of the room went from HOT to COLD and the air con had no say in this it seemed to have a mind of its own

Reviews.Title: “Radisson - like a comfortable pair of chic slippers”
Reviews.Author: jc067
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Radisson quite a lot over the last few years. It's always professional, the staff have always been courteous, the food has always been good and it's a good business hotel. I've never had any major gripes about it, which says something, as I tend to be a bit of Victor Meldrew when travelling. This hotel is like a comfortable pair of chic slippers, or how I imagine a pair would be, my own are actually a long way away from chic. I always look forward to staying here as I know my stay will be comfortable, I won't be disturbed by neighbours/room temp/rubbish food/uncomfortable beds etc. Essentially it's a great place to stay and get some work done if required or just chill out. it is pretty business focussed so I'm not sure I'd stay if I were paying, preferring something with a bit more character, but as a business hotel it hits the spot. I have only 2 points where they could improve, and what review would be complete without these. Ok, firstly, it's DARK....dark in reception, dining room, bar, dark in the lift, dark in the hall, and yup, pretty dark in the rooms. I am as eco friendly as the next person, but I do get a little tetchy when I have all the lights on and I still have to echolocate to find my way around. My second point is almost trivial, however, the few times I have mustered the energy to go to the gym, it is in a pretty sorry state. (the gym, not me/my workout). It's a tiny little room with a running machine, rowing machine and cycling machine. I think they got rid of the rubbish nautilus machine. Anyway, last time I went I set the running machine to max in an effort to try out a new Tabata training routine (brilliant, look it up) and while I was sprinting at my sweating max the (cheap) running machine seized up, with *hilarious* consequences. Luckily it was first thing in the morning and no one noticed me extricating my face from the digital display. However, apart from these two relatively minor issues I am more than pleased to stay at this hotel when on business.

Reviews.Title: “Good - great service”
Reviews.Author: jennerm
Reviews.Content: Good hotel - nice rooms, modern, not too noisy, GREAT staff, esp Erica

Reviews.Title: “Standard Radisson experience.”
Reviews.Author: Absolute_Traveller_X
Reviews.Content: Two nights stay in this very good hotel I would recommend to everyone staying in Paris. It is some 30 minutes from center by metro line 9, which is not so bad. It is just across the street from station Porte de st-Cloud in a good neighborhood. it is not as big as most Radisson hotels, more boutique hotel. Check in and check out was very efficient and staff was nice.Receptionist at the check in very informative and polite, breakfast staff attentive. I got a friends and family rate as I know a friend who works for the brand group, so that was great (80 EUR per room/per night). Breakfast was good, only the coffee was not up to standard, but i changed it for an real espresso...so problem solved. Only few small miss laps : no pool or wellness, only fitness room; bed covers are quite old and damaged, and since it is a five/four star venue...i must say..rooms need to be immaculate in terms of attention when cleaning the corners and carpets...which was done messy. :( overall : solid 4

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: kcplaza2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Radisson Blu last week on business and was very disappointed. I first was put in a room on the first floor that smelt like smoke and the Wifi signal didn't reach. I called and they apologized and said they'd find me another room. Nearly 30 minutes later I was put on the 7th floor. The young man who moved me said they know that side of the hotel on the 1st floor doesn't have a good Wifi signal. The room on the 7th floor was much better until I turned on the heater. It just started to blow hot air and couldn't be turned off. The room got so warm that I had to open the window. And the final nail if you will was the shower, which is a bathtub, actually shifted and moved. Meaning foundationally there was something very wrong. The good part of the hotel is the restaurant which served very good food and the staff, especailly the guys working the late shift. Very friendly, booked a taxi at 4am, got the coffee machine up and running eariler than usual. I go to Paris nearly every other month for work and this was one of the worst hotels I've stayed at and wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: UniqueGlobeTrekker
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this hotel on the 2009 New Year's eve, but my previous review wasn't that informative. This hotel is amazing! The modern feel to the place is great, the rooms tastefully decorated. We had everything we could possibly need, selections of tea, coffee, lots of TV chanells... The breakfast was one of the best I've ever had, a huge selection of diverse pastries, jams, ham, cheese (It's France :D). The staff very friendly, and spoke english as if that was their mother tongue, professional and efficient. The location is a bit far from the Eiffel tower, Louvre and other sights, but is withing a 5 min walk to St Cloud square where a metro station is (15-20 mins ride to above mentioned sights) and McDonald's and a few restaurants. Although it is near to a huge street (or a highway not sure) the noise was not a problem, the windows completely blocked out the sound. Overall I recommend this hotel for business travelers, and to all those who like urban atmosphere, remember: It isn't that far from the centre!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexsas777
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several Parisian hotels when working on the project in France, and I can name Radisson Blu as the best hotel I was staying in Paris. I escaped here from Pullman, and Radisson, charging almost the same rate was millions times better the former one: modern rooms, excellent breakfast, attentive staff - everything you miss in hotels in Paris - was present in Radisson. I would definitely recommend this hotel against any other in that area in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “another old favourite - the European one”
Reviews.Author: Matt O
Reviews.Content: Hvae stayed here many time on EuroMillions business and it is just what you need for overnight business trips

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cosy and modern”
Reviews.Author: 6voyageurs
Reviews.Content: Was there for a night on a busness trip. Nice and modern settings, people at the front desk always there to help you. 3 minutes from metro. A real neat stay.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be better”
Reviews.Author: PedroL7
Reviews.Content: Although service and staff continue to be very good and friendly, bedrooms are somewhat wasted - carpets and wall paper should be replaced in order to give them a cleaner feeling. Breakfast variety has decreased. It also became much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: alinas
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 10 days. It is more then most people do so you get to see mistakes (and as person working in travel industry it is my "hobby" (more like illness) to spot them :( Radisson IS a known chain and it is expected that staff is trained to perfection... here it is not: maid enters the room without knocking assuming that nobody is inside (5 minutes earlier room was empty, right?), it takes 3-4"trips" to reception - no kidding - for the reception staff to finally pass the message to maintenance guy to fix sth in the room. Oh btw: the room will be cold or too hot - heating/AC is broken so he has to manually set one or the other....once it is set you do not have control over it so you need to go to reception again and ask....why walk to reception?...hymm cause if you call them they think you get room service..I am not a native speaker but seriously....if you dont understand ask.. my question: "how to get to the airport?" TAXI ..wow that is great...would not think about that...so "what about cheaper options, you know: like public transportation? (the concierge asks me to ask the receptionist as he is not sure how ..) one more small thing: in the hotel you will find information that they try to be environmental friendly BUT they change towels every day (when NOT on the floor), soaps, shampoo bottles etc..maybe small thing but makes me feel very guilty. I preferred to not have the room cleaned at all then waste all of those resources, every day, unnecessarily :( room nice, clean, but when facing street (so you will probably have the window closed: AC/heating heeded)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lainee_L
Reviews.Content: I spent a good few hours (or it might have felt like days!) reading through all the very bad reviews for Paris hotels on this website. Finally decided between two hotels and eventually booked this one. We stayed at the hotel for three nights and I would definitely go back to the hotel if I was going to Paris. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean and modern, and are reasonably sized. There is a good choice of breakfast and the free wifi is a bonus. It's very close to the metro station and near lots of shops and restaurants. You may look at the location of the hotel and think it's a bit too far from the main sights but as with any major city, if the public transport is efficient, reliable and cheap like the Paris metro system is, then it really doesn't take too long to get to/from the hotel. I had emailed the hotel a week before we were due to arrive to find out how to get to the hotel via the metro station and they sent a very prompt and useful email. One of our requests was for feather-free bedding due to allergies, and this was indeed followed up. I definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Very Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LovTravelOz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as part of the Cosmos tour. The room is very clean and service is good. Breakfast is fantastic. Lot of variety and plentiful. Free wi-fi access. Close to metro stations. Lot of eating places around and grocery stores which make it very convenient if you want to get some fresh fruits and bottled water. Close to Versailles, about 2-3 stations. Be careful not to leave any bags in the lobby. 2 couples from our tour left their bags in the lobby and went for breakfast. The reception then locked the bags up in their security room. After breakfast, they thought the luggage have been taken to the coach, when it is not in the lobby.They did not realise the luggage have been left behind in Paris until they reach London. They have to pay for the luggage to be delivered to London. A very costly mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Phelzier
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night, but was upgraded to a suite when I checked in. The service was very friendly and the hotel was kept very clean. The bedroom and lounge was a decent size. The bathroom was ok, but the bath was quite narrow. Very good selection with the breakfast, although the scrambled eggs were the 'normal' runny kind. In terms of pricing of drinks and food, it didn't seem much different than anywhere else in Paris, so expect to pay over-the-odds than UK prices. I didn't use the gym, but I believe it is available at an additional charge. The location of the hotel is not in the city centre, but is a short journey on the metro, depending on where you wish to get to. The nearest metro station is Porte St. Cloud, which is less than 5 minutes walk. All in all, the offering from the hotel was supurb and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: moncic
Reviews.Content: Location is good, some 10min from the city center with the metro which is 3min walking distance from the hotel. The rooms are nice and cozy with very good sleep quality. Breakfast was also good with a nice variaty. The only thing I would complain about are the ridiculous prices in the mini bar. 5 eur for a small Evian is way too much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bring your walking shoes”
Reviews.Author: DeskTraveler
Reviews.Content: It's a comfortable 4 star business hotel that is starting to show some age. It's also on the edge of the city (in the "real" Paris) and takes about 25 minutes by metro to get to the sightseeing areas, although that also means 25 minutes less to get out to Versailles. However, if you search the Internet for the friends and family discount code for the hotel chain (Carlson is the parent company) you can spend much much less here than at any 4 star hotel in central Paris. In our case, during high-cost school holidays, we saved 60%. If you've done all the sightseeing and want to explore this more remote district, it is quite affluent and has many restaurants that were always busy, and of course many good bakeries. Although our reservation said a king size bed, I'm certain the bed was a queen size and the front desk staff refused to understand the issue. Otherwise, the staff was friendly and helpful when we needed to call our airline about a check-in issue.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with good service and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: S70Kj
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room at the 3rd floor. However, the bed was NOT king size, but bed, duvet and pillows were all very good. Clean and nice room and bathroom. Breakfast was very generous and had all the choises you expect from a good hotel. Pleasant staff. Short walk to Metro station (Porte St. Cloud) at line 9. Recommend to go in to city center to dine.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: glasgowteacher
Reviews.Content: In every sense of the word this hotel was perfect. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the rooms were so comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MsPattz
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to the reviews it got on tripadvisor and a deal I received on travelzoo (160 pounds per night). Pick this hotel if you're looking for a great room and you're not worried about location. This hotel had a massive room with a gorgeous table desk and great bathroom, all very modern and clean but it was far from central paris. Around 20 mins on the subway to the eiffel tower, and a 15 minute walk from the hotel to the subway station. We found that the journey was quite annoying because we weren't in the heart of the city where all the action was happening.We had breakfast inc too, which was great lots of french pastries mostly. Wifi was quite slow and we were overlooking another building. Not many people in the area spoke english either as it was quite suburby so bear this in mind! All in all, great room, not so great location.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from the central paris”
Reviews.Author: mandy62
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their website and was happy to be able to have a family suite. We are a family of four and needed the space badly! We arrived through metro and took us a while to find which way to go. It was a bit of a walk from the metro station and we realized that it is a bit further from all the sightseeings. That meant once leaving the hotel, there was no coming back to relax and refuel! The hotel itself was nice and clean; the staff were super helpful and the breakfast was plentiful. Be aware of the VAT charges though; something that i did not take into an account when i booked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great service!”
Reviews.Author: kanban25
Reviews.Content: Really loved my stay at this hotel. And keep going back time after time. Right next to the metro. Great for business travellers and the best there is in Boulogne.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wizard_of_odds
Reviews.Content: Typical 4 star business type hotel with all usual facilities. Located to the south west of the centre so, not in a leafy suburb althought there was a small park nearby. Unfortunately the volume of traffic passing did not make for a relaxing walk! A short walk from some local shops whcih are obviously for the locals (i.e not tourist oriented) whcih is a good thing. Short walk to the metro and about 20 minutes to the banks of the Seine. located on a busy road but good soundproofing in the room. I had a view of the Eiffel tower. Friendly & helpful staff, clean & comfortable room, free hi-speed wi-fi, poor choice of non-French TV channels (ok, I know, it is France - what did I expect?). Fitness room but no spa facilites which would have been nice, perhaps I shouldn't expect that in a 'city-centre' hotel but... Quite pricey but it is central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, defenently more than 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Machinehead28
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 19 june - 20 june. When I arrived, one of the staff persons took my suitcases and take care of them. The check in was very quickly, them room was very large and high quality. Breakfast was amazing, since it's include in the rate, I stayed in many hotels around Europe and I didn't have large vareity of foods. The fitness room very bad, only 4 machines for aerobic, no dumbells, multi-trainers, benchs. I order a taxi thru the hotels, after 5 mins, the taxi arrived. I'll come again to this hotel!.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: didiorissimo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near to metro so it's easy then to move around Paris area. Modern facilities with free internet which I find very good. Friendly staff and felt comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “radisson blu paris boulogne je t'aime.....”
Reviews.Author: nealjojo
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! My wife and I spent a most enjoyable extended week end in this splendid hotel. The connections to the centre of Paris are excellent, the metro and the bus station are a minute or two away; we usually took the bus , more scenic than the metro; number 22 to Opera or number 72 to Hotel de Ville. The hotel staff are very friendly; Yves on the reception gave us a warm welcome and took us to our room which had a lovely view of the tour eiffel; it was one of our rituals to watch it light up and sparkle at 10pm each evening! A variety of TV channels gave plenty of viewing choice. Restaurant and Bar are excellent. A la prochaine, Radisson blu Paris Boulogne!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel for service I have ever stayed in. The staff steal so leave nothing in your room.”
Reviews.Author: susanah27
Reviews.Content: The worst doorman I have ever encountered in the world when he wasn't ignoring you he was talking to people down the street about you. As obviously your a tourist so you don't speak French, the girl at the front desk wasn't any better when ever you asked her for anything she would tell you to ask the non existent, useless doorman. She was also quite rude. When you complain about the morning staff to the night staff, they say yes we have had this problem before. Make sure you lock everything up as they will steal from your room. They stole our shopping never even had the chance to take it out of the bag. Don't even bother to complain because the company won't even bother to get back to you.

Reviews.Title: “Closer to the city than you think”
Reviews.Author: german2
Reviews.Content: Finding a decent hotel in Paris is one of the big challenges, since hotels in Paris are generally overpriced and rather shabby. We were hesitating a bit since the pictures of the hotel look nice, but it seems to be far out. Well, we walked to the city center. Yes, it takes time (and the metro station is very close if you want to be quicker), but it was really a perfect choice for us. The staff was very friendly and helpful, breakfast was good, rooms clien and neat. In total the best hotel I have stayed in in Paris so far. Can recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: daiz888
Reviews.Content: I will definately return to this hotel in the future, even if its not this one but the other Radissons. The hotel looked very nice inside, rooms very big! The bathroom and the room itself had very nice decor. Bed was massive and very comfy. Only let down was that you can hear the underground trains every 2 mins. Was slightly disappointed about the 'gym'. The only thing lacking about the hotel is the lack of English speakers. If you required something, it will take a long time before they could understand. There was this very rude housekeeping black woman which had no manners at all and very rude. But i give it 10 out 10

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: tracymnh88
Reviews.Content: I work at a Radisson Blu hotel in Edinburgh and i was looking forward to experiance it for myself in another hotel on my holidays being a guest for once. And i have to say, Radisson you did me proud during our 4/5 day stay there! We arrived one day late to Paris due to our flight being cancelled but the hotel kindly dealt with it easily over the phone when we contacted them about our flights. The positivies =) - The hotel was glamorous and welcoming as you stepped into it, important due to the cold weather outside. The room was warm and spacious for the three of us, bed was comfy with massive fluffy pillows on top. We loved the hotel bar room downstairs - quiet and relaxing, perfect to sit with your friends for food or drinks. Food was awesome, bar staff were lovely and tried their best to understand us when we spoke in English. Another thing to point out was that we forgot to bring an umbrella over to Paris in this snowy/rainy weather so it was a nice that the hotel had extra ones near the reception entrance for us to borrow which was perfect.. kept us all dry throughout of holiday ^^!! The metro station (Porte De St Cloud) was about 5mins walk away which was convienant and there where shops/restarant in walking distance from the hotel. The city centre is about 30-40mins away by metro but if you dont want to travel that far then i recommend you to stay closer to the city centre because sometimes it is a trek. Lastly we paid staff rates while we where staying there so definately worth the money and stay THUMBS UP! The negatives =( - I was a little disappointed with the breakfast buffet, i thought there would be a bigger and wider selection of food as it was a "buffet". Another issue was that one of the housekeeping staff where abit rude, on the first night, we requested a few things up to the room and she looked annoyed as you took the items up for us. And she was rudely chewing her gum, didnt even say hello or bye when she walks in/out. But apart from this incident, the rest of the staff were excellant!

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Dafyda
Reviews.Content: Good, accomodation, very confortable double bed, great bathroom. The hotel is not in the centre of Paris but only 5 minutes from the metro station from where you can reach the centre in about 15 minutes. There are some supermarkets at about 10minutes' walk from the hotel that were very useful and few restaurants. There is also a shopping area nearby which was also very convenient. The breakfast was very rich and tasteful.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: sbgath
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently during a business trip. The business class room was clean and tidy, quiet and the bed was big and comfortable. On the plus side I should add the rich and fresh breakfast and that the staff were kind, helpful and English-speaking. Minor problems I faced was that the temperature in the room didn’t get as warm as I wished, the tv remote control had no batteries (I brought it downstairs and they fixed it), there was no Nespresso machine although the website listed it in the features of the Business Class room, the offered coffee-spoons in the room were dusty and the English-speaking tv channels didn’t have good reception (bad picture and sound). In general, it is a very nice, clean and modern hotel, I highly recommend it especially for business travellers, because no matter what issue you might face the staff will do their best to help you out in a very professional way. If I visit Paris for leisure though, I’d rather choose a more centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, easy to get to on the Metro”
Reviews.Author: greenday41
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. It was clean, in a very nice neighbourhood and there were a lot of decent restaurants and shops nearby. There's a McDonalds if you don't want to pay the prices of the restaurants. Staff weren't amazing but definitely OK. It's only fifteen minutes on the Metro from the Eurostar and the Eiffel Tower is only fifteen minutes away on the Metro too. The Parc des Princes is only a five minute walk from the hotel, we were in Paris for the Green Day concert and it was perfect. Overall this was one of the best hotels we've stayed at and I'd recommend it for anybody going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff, too many noises”
Reviews.Author: Marie49125
Reviews.Content: We were on a one bedroom suite facing the street and there was construction on the side of the building and we could also hear the traffic. We managed fine with ear plugs as we always do in cases like this. We had one problem of sewage smell coming once a day from the street (we had some kind of balcony) the maid kept on spraying "Febreeze" but it was coming back everyday. Other than that, the place is central, the suites are clean and well appointed (I would have like a microwave for my baby meal, but the staff at restaurant downstairs were kind enough to help so no big deal). I would recommend for family who needs to be in "central" Paris for a decent price. Staff is fluent english which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mehrdadnb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at this hotel. the hotel seems to be a bit far from center but actually the distance is not too far from main attractions ( 12 euros by taxi to Eiffel ) also a metro station is 2minutes by walk from the hotel ( port st. cloud station ) make this hotel a good choice for business & leisure. the neighborhood is calm and green . the hotel itself has modern design with spacious rooms comparing to Paris hotels standards . we stayed in a one bedroom suite (50 sq meters) large enough for 4 of us . check-in was fast and easy (since we were coming from Athens the quick procedure was quite a relief ). service was good during our stay and we did not observe any major flaws . breakfast was OK but can be better. rooms were clean and room service was responsive . free wireless internet is a big plus in this hotel. the only thing is that I believe the hotel was a bit understaffed ( or maybe some were on vacation ) but as mentioned above it didn't affected our experience. overall it's a nice hotel and good choice in Paris . I will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean friendly Hotel 30 mins by Metro from most of the sights of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Flyerboy01
Reviews.Content: We landed into CDG and took the train and metro to the hotel which took a little over an hour other than the stress of the metro and which platform all went well. We where greeted by a pleasant chap on reception at check in who was most helpful through out our stay. The room was clean, basic and a reasonable size for Paris. In room Nespresso coffee would have been nice although there where the standard coffee making facilities available. We enjoyed our stay and found the breakfast to be basic but very nice. We stayed 3 nights and travelled into Paris by metro which was straight forward and average journey times around 20 - 30 mins to most places. We did get a taxi to the Eiffel tower and this cost 15 euro. Roma FC where checking in as we departed which was a real distraction for my partner!!. In summary a nice pleasant hotel the rooms where clean the hotel has a comfortable lounge/bar and dinning can be taken on the outdoor terrace at the centre of the hotel if preferred. The hotel is approx 30 mins from most of the sights of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - poor service”
Reviews.Author: Ranger215
Reviews.Content: Basically a good hotel - renovated rooms (can be loud if heading to the street!), nice atmosphere; I was very disappointed by the level of service, however. After being asked for any preferences at check-in I mentioned not wanting to have a room next to an elevator. When I went to my room I had to find out it was located directly next to the elevators. Back at the front desk I had to wait quite a long time as the receptionist was chatting privately. Got a new room, but internet access didn't work; called the front desk several times, where they mentioned my problem will be fixed - but it never was. Such bad service leaves a bad flavor

Reviews.Title: “A well appointed hotel within reach of Paris's main sights”
Reviews.Author: Kuchinga
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel to be close to Roland Garros for the French Open Tennis tournament. It's a 10-15 minute walk to the tournament venue through quite pretty tree lined streets. The room I stayed in was well appointed and had the amenities and fittings one would expect of a 4 star hotel. The hotel is close to the Porte de St Cloud subway station making it about 20 minutes from the main sights - Musee de Orsay, Notre Dame... by subway. Breakfast was pricey but the spread was good and the outdoor terrace was lovely. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Blu Porte St Cloud”
Reviews.Author: cherryplum
Reviews.Content: 16 stations and a change from the Gare du Nord, it looks a long way but in reality took less than 30mins with no hassle. Arrived at GDN 1420hrs in the room at 1510hrs and got a very pleasingly warm welcome at the Radisson Blu; twin room with clean modern bathroom and good shower, very comfortable beds with excellant pillars and light warm duvets. There is also free wifi; decent toiletries and good size room. Staff contact and inter-action was very good and help offered in a very friendly way. Location is mostly about money in Paris and this was a moderate charge of USD135/GBP85.00/EUR90 on a weekend deal on food. Eating locally produced some really good food with an average cost of EUR40 pp with wine and that was not for tacky touristy food. Breakfasts at the hotel are expensive EUR24 so a visit to one of the many bakers shops and a coffee in a bar meant EUR10 for 2 persons. Good restaurants are A & M, Cardinal and Cafe Caves all well worth a visit and guess what no tourists. A good location to get to Versailles and so easy even by bus to the Arc De Triumph and Galleries Laffayette. A good tip when travelling from London by Eurostar is to buy the Metro tickets at St Pancras (for 3 days I bought a carnet and 2 2day tickets for 2 persons for GBP40.00 which gave excellant value and the add on to Versailles was GBP6.00 purchased locally).. With the tickets in hand Train to metro is as quick as you want to make it and no messing with queues or machines. Had a great 3 night stay doing all the things tourists do with endless walking and long days; this was our 10th visit but this time we went to the top of the Arc, a thorough visit to Notre Dame and the Pantheon, excellant treck through the Concierges and a The Gallery in the Tullieries for the Monet and impressionist exhibition plus Versailles and the Gardens all on a very wet and cold weekend - great!!

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: scrutineer44
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great location with subway about 3 minutes walking distance and from there the heart of Paris is 15 minutes away or so. Nice amenities and very nice staff, free internet service in room and lobby. Rather nice restaurants across the expressway at the traffic circle, about 5 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far from the Centre”
Reviews.Author: AnnieHEngland
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from the Radisson Blu in Paris where I spent a weekend to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We travelled by Eurostar to the Gare du Nord and the journey to the hotel took about half an hour on the Metro. We decided to walk to the Eiffel Tower along the Seine from the hotel without realising how far it was, about 4-5 kilometres! After that we stuck to the Metro! The hotel itself is quite a high standard, the room was very large, comfortable bed and crisp linen, large bathroom. Although it was a non smoking room it smelt very strongly of cigarette smoke which was a shame. The tea and coffee making facilities were not great, only one normal tea bag, along with one Earl Grey and one herbal tea and only one sachet of milk. There was no water provided free of charge and a small bottle of water cost 5 euros from the mini bar so we bought our own water from the supermarket! The breakfast was okay, plenty to eat for a continental breakfast but the cooked items were only average. The bread rolls were so hard they were inedible and the scrambled eggs were fairly tasteless. However, plenty to eat and a good choice. Overall, nice hotel, good rooms but I would advise you to take tea bags (if you want tea) and buy milk. To be fair we didn't ask for extra supplies and these may have been provided if requested. If we go to Paris again will definitely choose a hotel closer to the main attractions as it always seemed a long journey to get to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff good location for Metro”
Reviews.Author: gman48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 10th Wedding Anniversary for 3 nights (Thur - Sun). The hotel is as you might expect for a 4* hotel, smart, clean modern decor. The room was reasonably spacious for 2 of us, clean and in good condition. There is a Metro about 5 mins walk called Porte Saint Cloud on M9 line. (Note there is another Porte Saint Cloud on M10 which is 30 mins walk if you make that mistake which we did on the first day!!) Front desk staff were extra helpful and pleasant going out of their way to help us organise trips etc. The hotel is not that large and hence not that busy, the foyer was quiet as was the room. Location is actually just outside Paris but as the hotel is on the M9 metro line you can be standing in front of the Eiffel Tower or on the Champs Elises within 20mins and it's very well positioned for a trip to Versailles which we would recommend on a nice day. We did not eat in the hotel as the prices were very high. For breakfast there are plenty of places nearby, we bought breakfast from the local bakery for 4 euro each day and used the tea/coffee in the room. For lunch and dinner we ate in Paris depending on where our sightseeing had taken us. We found drinks espcially beer very expensive in Paris typically 6-8 euros for less than 0.5l. We got a good rate for this hotel at around £80 per night in August which was significantly lower than most 4* hotels at the time and easily worth the 15 minute Metro ride every day. If you can get a good rate for this hotel I would definitely recommend it as the hotel is excellent if a bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “More or less good until the last evening”
Reviews.Author: ianb77
Reviews.Content: I just spent six nights at the Radisson in Boulogne and apart from a few minor quibbles (no replacement of bathroom toiletries or capsules for the Nespresso machine, the tiny fitness room with its outdated and broken equipment, the narrowest king bed in existence and the fact that it took two days for them to note that breakfast was included in my rate), I was perfectly happy for most of my stay. The room was spacious, quiet and comfortable, the staff were friendly and helpful and there's a great Japanese restaurant, Sanki, just across the avenue. However, when I returned to the room on my last day there, I found a very unpleasant letter telling me that they would like me to pay my bill right away as it had exceeded a certain amount and they had had problems in the past with large bills. This in spite of taking my credit card details on arrival. They had also added breakfast for one day to the bill (even though it was included) and a charge for the minibar that I hadn't even touched. The tone of the letter was extremely aggressive, virtually accusing me of wanting to leave without paying. I immediately went down to reception where they told me that it was company policy to issue such letters to customers whose bills reach a certain level. I have never encountered anything like this before from Starwood or Accor Hotels and it's really put me off staying at a Radisson again (it was my first stay with them and isn't likely to be repeated). I refused to pay until leaving the following morning and the incident ended there. But it left me with a very unpleasant memory of what could have been an otherwise pleasant stay. Be warned also that the room service costs are exorbitant (40 euros for two slices of smoked salmon, a fruit salad and a bottle of water) and that parking in the hotel garage costs 18 euros a day, even though the hotel's web-site makes no mention of this.

Reviews.Title: “As ever, the service lets it down”
Reviews.Author: eurobunnylondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times and whilst the hotel is confortable and the rooms are great - invariably it is the bar and breakfast service that always let every stay down. Tonight - with only 4 people on the bar - I sat and waited for service for over 10 minutes as the barman was engrossed in a conversation with 2 of the customers and did not look round once despite repeated requests. Ridiculous when there are so few customers. Breakfast is generally a horror - dirty tables, coffee only brought if you ask at least twice. Te whole stay would be so much better if the manager taught his team the art of client service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great amenities, quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiSly
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris and it was for work - so the hotel was chosen for us. At first I was disappointed that we were not staying close to all the tourist attractions or closer into the old city. However, this location turned out to be fine and also very reasonable for the quality of the room and amenities. The neighborhood is residential, very close to the Porte de Saint Cloud (traffic circle with a lot of shops and restaurants). You can also walk from the hotel to the circle where there is both Metro and bus service...very short walk. There is a nice but expensive restaurant in the hotel, where they served a very nice breakfast buffet, plated lunches and dinners, and had a nice trendy (but small) bar. Drawback: all the food and drinks were expensive - 9 euro for a cocktail, 25 euro for breakfast. The rooms were very nice and, though kind of small by American standards, were equipped with a large picture window overlooking the street and city, large flat screen tv with lots of channels (mostly French but some in English), very nice bath with tub/shower combo, nice towels, etc., and a desk/sitting area. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and not the stereotypical "rude" French at all. In fact, during my whole trip I never encountered one rude person (except for Americans). There was wireless internet in the hotel and in our room but I found it difficult to get a consistent signal on my laptop. The concierge at the desk was helpful in making recommendations on where to walk for dinner...the entire staff spoke excellent English and was extremely helpful and friendly. During the week we were having such a great time and were looking to possibly add two more nights onto the end of our stay. The hotel was unfortunately booked, but the front desk staff went out of their way to find us another hotel where we could stay in the area, and even booked the reservation for us and got us a good rate versus what I got when calling the hotel myself. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have American-style hotel amenities but doesn't want to pay the higher price for a hotel closer in to the city. One more tip: we rode the Metro one time from the neighborhood into the city...after that, we took a tour book piece of advice and rode the buses. They are clean, cheap, and a great way to get on and off where you like when you see something interesting. You also get to see a lot of the city when riding, versus being underground all the time in the Metro. Buy a week-long pass for 18 euro (called the Orange card) and you can ride any time you want, unlimited, through the entire city of Paris and the suburbs. It is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty, not very well cared of.”
Reviews.Author: travelbee2008
Reviews.Content: A mediocre hotel, quite expensive for that money. For a four-star facility is barely enoug. It is a pity that no one helps with the luggage, with calling a cab etc.

Reviews.Title: “NOT just for business!”
Reviews.Author: SelenaBartlett
Reviews.Content: Checking into the hotel was a breeze and not only did our room have enough space for us both and our baby, but the travel cot had been put up, extra bedding for the cot was in place and the welcome chocolate packs were a real treat. We switched on the tv to find it didn't work - a lady from reception came up within a minute of the call and we were upgraded to another room (for the inconvenience!!!!). The room was clean and in very good order. Breakfast buffet had a huge selection and the staff were more than happy to heat milk for our baby to drink - they also had a highchair and on the second day it was in place in the restaurant waiting for us when we go there! The lounge is accessed via the bar and once again, having a baby with us was not problem (as it has been in many other hotels). Above all I would highly recommend the hotel as I feel they could not have done any more for us and our stay was very enjoyable. PS - the restaurant Le Princes (near the church) is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Good four-star”
Reviews.Author: jyvais
Reviews.Content: Nice contemporary room with great bathroom. Good service and breakfast. Close to a metro station but not much around though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PennyLaneSussex
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel if you are on business in this part of Paris. The rooms are spacious with a separate work area and free internet access. Unlike other reviewers I have never had any problems with the internet access. The rooms have tea/coffee making facilities as well as a mini bar. I think the breakfast is pretty good, but I agree with the comments previously made about the poor quality of the scrambled eggs ! The bar and restaurant are expensive so it is best to go elsewhere in the neighbourhood or into the centre of Paris. The metro is close by and the Champs D'Elyesee is about 20 minutes away. However, taxis in Paris are cheap and good value compared to most European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mon180
Reviews.Content: Was booked in as part of a large group staying at the hotel. Check-in was very quick and easy - staff were friendly. Thought the rooms were very modern and clean. Luckily we weren't visiting Paris as tourists - since as mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is located a long distance from main Paris and all the tourist attactions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...but a little too far away from the centre”
Reviews.Author: LS22
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, very modern and the decor in the room is gorgeous. Very good standard in the bedroom and bathroom - comfortable, immaculate and spacious. Unfortunately the hotel is quite a long taxi or metro ride away from the centre of Paris and the main attractions. Would make an excellent base for a business trip, but for sight seeing not ideal, particularly if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: The trip did not start that well, as I had to hang around and wait for my room to be ready for over 3 hours, with conflicting stories from reception during that time. Basically I think the hotel had been very full the night before with large parties that all only checked out late so they had a huge catch-up. They implied as I was here they would give my room priority - but they did not. There was good news though as my assistant who had booked a block of rooms for the meeting we were having, had negotiated a suite for me at the same rate. The suite was pretty good. Small lounge area, with a flat screen TV, and then in corner a desk to work at. There is free wired and wireless access (though it was not working, and so more a theory than a reality!). Then there was a good sized bedroom with good sized bed, which is comfortable too. There is another flat screen TV. There is a fairly good selection of TV channels in different languages, and as a very frequent traveler with only really English as my language, it was great to have BBC 1 and 2 and not just the news channels to watch! The hotel is on a very busy road and so is not the quietest as rooms have traffic noise. But it is not too loud, and ear plugs blocks it all out. The breakfast buffet is pretty good, though expensive if not part of your package (22 Euros). It is always packed as the hotel seems to have coach/ tour groups galore! Overall this is a fairly good hotel with decent rooms and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room! Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: queenemyli
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Paris for our anniversary for four days. The hotel we stayed in was absolutely gorgeous, and it was by far better than I had imagined. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by 4 members of staff, who were very kind and helpful during all of our stay. They speak really good english, which really helped! There was a beautiful lounge, with a mezzanine of the first floor of which were hotel rooms which we stayed in. It was a luxury design! I was very impressed with the hotel room just as I was with the hotel in general, and I have taken photographs so please take a look! The room has a very modern feel to it, and there was also a wall fitted flat screen TV! There aren't much english channels to watch, but there are a few american channels, and BBC 1 and 2. There are movies which you can watch but you have to pay. Of course, we didn't come to watch TV! But during one of the late nights me and my boyfriend watched The Pursuit Of Happiness and Stomp The Yard which were about 7 EUR each, but we enjoyed both movies greatly. Very quiet during our stay too, and it wasn't so busy. Nothing bothered us during the nights.. we always slept until midday because I guess we were so comfortable! They gave us room service everyday of our stay, even though we didn't really require it that often, which I found really sweet. They changed all our towels everyday, and even our bed sheets! So everyday we came home to a brand new room! What more can you ask for? Other information: The travel adapter we brought was wrong, so don't worry, you can rent one there for 5 EUR, which you can get back at the end of your stay. There is also free broadband internet access there for business customers. The safe was also very high tech and safe too. There is free coffee and tea in the mini bar which we managed to finish on the second night! The restaurant looked interesting too, but the price list wasn't too impressive. There are so many restaurants just opposite the road of the hotel, which was more filling than anything! Paris: Overall, travel was by far more convenient than London. The french must hate walking, since the stops are so close to each other. But BEWARE, the tube map is so complexed! Porte de St Cloud is the nearest station to the hotel, and getting to places like the Tour Eiffel, Galeries Lafayette was easy and fairly quick... in fact everywhere was pretty convenient as the stops went really quickly. If in doubt, just take a taxi because they are also quite cheap! People in paris don't really speak english. Well, they do, but they are too lazy to talk to you in english, they like to prefer to answer to you in french. Especially in restaurants. It was fairly cold when we went to Paris, but we very much enjoyed our stay and the atmosphere there. We also went to disneyland on the last day also which was really fun! I really recommend this hotel for anyone who is planning on visiting Paris, as you will find it will really add comfort to your stay. There are other branches of this hotel, I believe one in centre of Paris too. I hope this review has helped you into finding a hotel for your stay, please feel free to email me for any other questions you may have! Hope you have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic anniversary weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Cattipoops
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend in Paris for our anniversary. This is a great hotel if you're on a bit of a budget but don't want too far to travel into the centre of Paris. It's only a tube ride away so it's no hassle to get to and from and is well worth it! We chose the Radisson as we have stayed with this chain before and knew what we were getting. It was very clean and provided us with a great base to enable us to explore the city! We didn't eat in the hotel apart from breakfast in bed which was very good. The service could not be faulted. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room (what more could you want?!). I would recommend this hotel if you too are going to Paris for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: isapoussin
Reviews.Content: The most of everything. Room was fanrastic, clean big, modern. Staff friendly, dining amazing ( the best pastas ever, event after an extended trip to Italy)! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gg99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson on business for 3 nights. Hotel was brighter and more modern than most European hotels in this price range. Had a flat screen TV. Hallways were newer and brighter than usual. Lobby area was small but plenty of seating room and inviting. Room and bed were decent, bathroom was large with good water pressure. Concierge and desk staff definitely showed effort in trying to be helpful. They were able to provide a room even though I was checking in fairly early in the morning. The concierge staff was able to direct me on foot to a couple of nearby locations. Getting a taxi was painful however, especially around 8 AM, so if possible, leave earlier or use another mode of transportation. The metro and buses are a very short walk away, and only a few stops from the center of Paris (took about 30 minutes to get to Musee d'Orsay for example). Had one dinner at the restaurant, and the food was adequate. I found the service to be friendly and they made an excellent wine recommendation. Overall, if looking for a hotel in the Issy/Boulogne/Porte de St. Cloud area, I would choose this hotel over the others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a bit further from downtown”
Reviews.Author: derek04
Reviews.Content: We stay there for a day during our honeymoon ( we spent the rest of week at Radisson near Paris Boulogne AVE eDOUARD Vaillant 31-33.), Hotel is great, very clean and morden. Staff are very helpful. Breakfast was great fro about 30 bucks. We got there 7:00am and was raining, the staff let us into a room rightaway. The subway is 5 min walk, which is fine. But if you come home later through subway, I am not sure how safe is around. I think if you know your way around, or with lots of people, this is an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved since opening”
Reviews.Author: ParisExpat
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights here in October 2007 and was very pleasantly surprised at the progress that's been made since they first opened in 2005. Although this was my first stay here, I had a group of colleagues stay there for 2 months in Sep-Oct 2005 just after the hotel had opened (I was living in Paris at the time) and found the service and general demeanor of staff to be consistently indifferent and irritable, and sometimes chaotic. Given the memory of this, I had been a little reluctant to book a stay here. Based on a 3-day stay, this appears now to have greatly changed. Staff were friendly and very accommodating (especially by Paris standards), both at reception and in the bar/restaurant areas. Restaurant food is traditional French fare, and very, very good, if somewhat costly, although the staff seemed unable to advise on the wine list (may have just been that particular night). The surrounding area is of little interest to tourists, being on the edge of Paris proper ('intra-muros') but transport into the centre is quick and easy by metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristaBelleGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great weekend in Paris and thoroughly enjoyed our Radisson stay. We managed to get a good rate but would be prepared to stay here again at the full price. We had worried that it was too far out of the city centre but the Paris Metro is easy and quick to use so we really didn't notice the 15 mins or so that it took us to get in. On the first day we walked from our hotel along the river to the Eiffel Tower and that helped with our orientation and didn't take too long. We had a good room on the 8th floor (top?) and had everything we could need in a hotel room, as previous reviewers have noted. The staff were extremely helpful and charming to deal with. We left our luggage at both ends of our stay and enjoyed a coffee in the bar as we waited to check in and when waiting to go back to the airport. All very relaxing, surrounded by modern, tasteful decor and pleasant staff. We ate in the restaurant on the first night. Not cheap but the food was good and the service was excellent. We have previously stayed in the Radisson in Copenhagen and continue to think well of this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: KayD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in February for a reasonable rate of £70 per room per night, booked through lastminutetravel.com. This price included breakfast. The hotel is what you would expect from a Radisson SAS, very modern, clean, professional staff, overall a very high standard. We stayed in a twin room, very nicely decorated, with high quality fittings and furnishings and an LCD TV. The bathroom was also of a high standard. The area is quite busy at night and there are a number of restaurants a short walk away. Although when we were there the hotel's restaurant was not open for dinner. Breakfast however, was buffet style and of a high quality. The hotel is a little far out from the centre of Paris but the Metro stop is a few minutes walk away and from there you can get around very easily. Overall I would recommend this hotel as a cheaper alternative to staying in central Paris, whilst of a very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a business trip - was very impressed with the hotel! It was modern and comfortable - the room and bathroom were huge by Paris standards! The bed was extremely comfortable and the entire space spotless. The Metro is very close so it's easy to get around and see the sights of central Paris. Staff/concierge were very helpful, although I think they gave us wrong information a few times (telling us that we couldn't just "show up" at a local restaurant, the concierge had to call and when we got there the place was empty; told my husband there was only one dinner cruise company when there are actually several, etc.). I think they must have an agreement with those places and get some kind of commission for referrals, which is fine - just be honest about it! Another poster mentioned a local restaurant, Chez Michel - it is actually only one block away, on the street that comes out directly in front of the hotel. It was a nice little place and the food was excellent, one of the best meals we had in Paris all week! It was a fairly easy day trip to Versailles from here - about 45 minutes total (short Metro plus an easy-to-catch bus). The hotel bar was hip and comfortable and the food in the restaurant very good. There is a small but well equipped fitness center and internet access is free. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcome in an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrc_uk2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night at the end of July. I have stayed in a couple of Radissons hotels and I must say that this was by far the best in terms of friendly service and the welcoming atmosphere the staff in this hotel give. The room was clean, tidy and very well presented, and the little touches made the difference, like chocolates on the bedside table and a welcome note from the manager. Buffet breakfast was included in my reservation and the choice on offer was wide and varied, even to the point of instead of little individual plastic pots of honey, to having a honeycomb section from a bee hive hanging over a bowl. You can't really get fresher honey than that. The bacon/sausages and hot items weren't of a really high standard but the continental side of the buffet more than made up for that. Fresh pastries and breads, plus a good selection of fruits, yogurts and cold meats and cheeses. Yes the hotel isn't situation directly central in Paris but there is a bus stop and a metro stop just over the motorway bridge at the end of the road, giving you quick access to Line 9 for the metro which takes around 25 mins to get you in to the centre of Paris or 10 mins to the Eiffel Tower. If you are stopping for short break then I would highly recommend a stay in this hotel. It does justice and more to the Radisson brand.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for visitingParis”
Reviews.Author: b2dac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two weeks ago on a family visit to Paris planned at the last minute. I was unsure about staying on the outskirts but found that the hotel was ideal. It is five minutes at most (over a pedestrian bridge which crosses the peripherique) to the metro line at Porte St Cloud from which you can go anywhere on the Paris metro. The bus terminus is also nearby from whcih you have easy bus access to Trocadero, Arc de Tropmhe and Opera. The staff were excellent and very helpful. The room was fine and very clean. The hotel is busy - lots of business people, but for the four day city break we were on we didn't mind. Breakfast was very good. (I do agree with the person who warned about the sausages i.e. if you are used to the British/Irish sausage these look but do not taste the same!). All in all - we were very pleased and would recommend.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Paris-Boulogne
HotelInfo.Address: 33 av Edouard Vaillant, 92100 Paris, France
